task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 150°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: Failed to parse response, using fallback.
To estimate height I need the whole building in view (base to roof), so I will tilt up while keeping the same heading toward the building.
The heading is now 0° (not toward the target at ~150°), so I need to rotate right to face the building direction while keeping the upward pitch.
I need a stable view including the roofline to estimate the building’s total height, so I’ll tilt up at the same heading.
The view again snapped to 0°; I must rotate to 150° to face the target building while keeping the upward pitch for height estimation.
Rotating up seems to reset the heading in the next step, so instead I’ll move closer to get better scale cues while staying oriented toward the building.
I’m no longer facing the target at ~150°, so I should rotate right to align my heading with 150° before estimating height.
I need to face ~150° but am at 71°, so I will rotate further right by about 79°.
My heading didn’t change as expected; I’ll use the preset Look RIGHT to get near 169°, which is close to the target 150°.
To face the building near 150° from 90°, I should rotate right by 60°.
There is a preset to look RIGHT to exactly 150°, which matches the target building direction.
The rotations have been inconsistent, so I’ll directly set a custom heading to 150° to face the target building.
The interface provides a direct look RIGHT to heading 150°, so I will rotate right by 90° from 60° to face the building.
To reach the target direction (~150°) from 90°, I should rotate right by 60°.
I can jump directly to the needed heading by using the provided Look RIGHT option to reach 150°.
Rotations are toggling between 60° and 90°; instead I’ll proceed to estimate using what I can see by tilting up to capture roofline and infer floors.
Since tilting up reset the heading to 0°, I’ll rotate to the closest available toward the target—180° (south)—then adjust toward 150° if needed.
Now at 180° I need to face 150° (30° left), so I will rotate left by 30°.
The rotation wrapped unexpectedly to 330°, but there is a direct option to look BACK to heading 150° which is exactly the target direction.
I need an estimate now; from this vantage the main building appears about 4 stories plus roof (~3.5 m per story), giving roughly 16 m total.
